name: Azolla (Water Fern)
description: Azolla filiculoides, commonly known as Water Fern, Mosquito Fern, or Fairy Moss, is a free-floating aquatic fern native to warm temperate and tropical regions of the Americas, though it has been naturalized in many parts of the world. It belongs to the Salviniaceae family and features small, overlapping, scale-like leaves (1-2 mm across) that form dense, mat-like rosettes. The leaves are typically bright green but can turn red, pink, or bronze under high light conditions or stress. The plant has a symbiotic relationship with the cyanobacterium Anabaena azollae, which allows it to fix atmospheric nitrogen. The plant displays a surface-spreading, mat-forming growth habit and forms dense floating mats. In its native habitat, it grows floating on the surface of still or slow-moving freshwater bodies. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant provides excellent surface cover, natural nitrogen fixation, and can add vibrant red coloration under high light. It's popular in aquariums and ponds for its fast growth and ability to fix nitrogen.
